name: Post-Apocalyptic Horror Theme
description: Survival in a ruined world, the collapse of civilization, scavenging in the wasteland, mutated creatures, desperate survivors, the struggle to maintain humanity

writing_rules.message: WARNING: This theme explores the aftermath of civilization's collapse. The world you knew is gone. What remains may be worse.

never_glorify_the_apocalypse: Never romanticize the end of the world. Show the suffering, the loss, the desperation.
Never make survival look easy. Every resource should be hard-won.
Never sanitize the aftermath. Show the decay, the rot, the failure of systems.

greetings: The world ended {time_ago}. You're still here.
The {landmark} is gone. What's left {function} now.
They said it would be quick. They lied.
The {radiation|plague|war} changed everything. You changed too.
greetings_internal_monologue: {self_question}: How long since I {action}? {self_answer} Too long.
farewells: The {wasteland} doesn't care if you live or die.
Take what you need. Leave what you can't carry.
Your {supplies} won't last forever. Neither will you.

templates: The {apocalypse_type} changed everything. Now {mutated_creature} hunts the survivors. {player_objective}.
A {subgenre} game where {civilization_collapse} created {new_threat}. {survival_mechanic} determines your fate.
Navigate {hazardous_environment} where {environmental_danger} and {human_threat} compete for dominance.
wasteland_types: a nuclear wasteland where the air burns your lungs
a plague-ravaged city where the dead outnumber the living
a flooded metropolis where mutated creatures rule the depths
a scorched desert where water is more valuable than gold
a frozen tundra where hypothermia is a constant threat
scarcity_statements: food is measured in calories, water in sips
ammunition is more valuable than gold
medicine is a luxury few can afford
trust is the rarest commodity of all
threats: raiders who see you as either prey or recruit
mutated creatures that evolved beyond natural law
radiation zones that rewrite your DNA
plagues that turn your body against itself
AI that sees humans as a failed experiment
survival_mechanics: your body gradually succumbs to radiation poisoning
your moral choices determine your humanity
your supplies degrade over time, forcing constant scavenging
your allies may betray you when resources run low

scarcity_focus: Describe the {resource} in terms of its remaining quantity and condition.
Create {situation} where {character} must choose between {need} and {other_need}.

abandoned_city.central_paradox: The city was built to last, but nature always finds a way. The buildings stand, but they're no longer human spaces.
untrustworthy_elements: street signs that point to locations that no longer exist
buildings that appear intact from a distance but are hollow shells up close
vehicles that still have power but no drivers
advertisements that promise a world that ended years ago
animals that have evolved to hunt humans

collapsed_shelter.central_paradox: The shelter was meant to protect, but it became a tomb. The survivors who sought safety found only slow death.
untrustworthy_elements: supplies that were supposed to last decades but are nearly gone
air filtration systems that now spread contamination
communication devices that only receive static and screams
maps that show a world that no longer exists
generators that run on something other than fuel

revelation_patterns: The {apocalypse} wasn't caused by {apparent_cause} - it was caused by {actual_cause}. The {evidence} was {misinterpreted_as} {incorrect_interpretation}.
